pullrequest.title: Permit trigger slope to be specified for wait timeouts

content.raw:
Hey Russ,

You should go into your fork's settings and set 'default reviewers' to Phil and me. We configured this in mainline repos, but forks don't inherit the change if forked before the change was made, and pull request settings are stupidly based on the fork rather than the destination. Or you can manually add reviewers. Anyway I'm approving this since I know you've been using it for ages.
content.html:
Hey Russ,

You should go into your fork's settings and set 'default reviewers' to Phil and me. We configured this in mainline repos, but forks don't inherit the change if forked before the change was made, and pull request settings are stupidly based on the fork rather than the destination. Or you can manually add reviewers. Anyway I'm approving this since I know you've been using it for ages.

pullrequest.title: Permit trigger slope to be specified for wait timeouts

content.raw: Shouldn’t this line pass the `timeout_trigger_type` to the `trigger_edge_type` keyword argument? Otherwise the trigger will default to ‘rising’.
content.html: Shouldn’t this line pass the timeout_trigger_type to the trigger_edge_type keyword argument? Otherwise the trigger will default to ‘rising’.

pullrequest.title: Permit trigger slope to be specified for wait timeouts

content.raw: Actually no - this trigger is for the output of the waitmonitor that is fed back to its input, not the one going to pseudoclock to resume it after a timeout. So they're distinct. Deleting  `trigger_edge_type='rising',` seems unrelated to this pull request, and has no effect since that is the default value of that argument for a `Trigger` in any case.
content.html: Actually no - this trigger is for the output of the waitmonitor that is fed back to its input, not the one going to pseudoclock to resume it after a timeout. So they're distinct. Deleting trigger_edge_type='rising', seems unrelated to this pull request, and has no effect since that is the default value of that argument for a Trigger in any case.

pullrequest.title: Permit trigger slope to be specified for wait timeouts

content.raw: This wasn't coming up on my Bitbucket dashboard (presumably because of the default reviewers issue), so it fell off my radar. But now that I've noticed it again, it looks fine so I'm merging,
